info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino and Yavapai Counties through 345 PM MST... At 314 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Page Springs, or 9 miles south of Sedona. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Camp Verde, Mcguireville, Village At Oak Creek, Montezuma Well, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Rimrock, Middle Verde, Lake Montezuma, Cornville, Wet Beaver Creek Campground and V Bar V Visitors Center. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 291 and 305. State Route 260 between mile markers 213 and 214. State Route 179 between mile markers 299 and 306. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
